channel.title: Project Ultimatum
channel.description:
Anyone who wishes to join the Development Team for Project Ultimatum will need:
Basic Knowledge on Java Coding.
Why Basic? Because not all people know alot, and you have to start somewhere and I'm willing to give them people a chance.
Good Knowledge on English (Language).
Why Good? Because that's my first and only Language.
"Okay" Grammar.
Why Grammar? I hate people who type like this: 0h 1n1t m4t3. And don't have patience trying to read chav writing.
Windows Live Messenger (MSN).
Why Windows Live Messenger? This is the way we will communicate.
And also to note, I've been coding for a good 2 - 3 years.
Project Ultimatum Team:
VestaPK Shoveb1
Interested? Post a comment or add me on MSN and let me know.
Andy-raffo@hotmail.co.uk
Thanks.

item.title: Project Ultimatum
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

[quote=“VestaPK, post:2, topic:337655”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=434058.msg3187148#msg3187148 date=1271880731]
They are two different languages.

en.wikipedia.org

Comparison of Java and C++

This is a comparison of Java and C++, two prominent object-oriented programming languages. The differences between the programming languages C++ and Java can be traced to their heritage, as they have different design goals. C++ was designed for systems and applications programming (i.e. infrastructure programming), extending the procedural programming language C, which was designed for efficient execution. To C, C++ added support for object-oriented programming, exception handling, lifetime-bas...

I’m not trying to flame or anything, but you don’t look smart if you start saying C++ and Java are the same language.
[/quote]

Its 95% the same C++ is just for systems. Java is for Developers.[/quote]

You are literally too stupid to make fun of.

Read full topic

item.title: Project Ultimatum
item.dc:creator: @Natey Natey
item.description:
@Natey wrote:

Wow you don’t know anything about java nor c++

Java import codes:

import java.awt.peer.CanvasPeer;

c++

#include <iostream>
#include <stdlib.h>

Learn the differences, idiot.

Read full topic

item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

They are two different languages.

en.wikipedia.org

Comparison of Java and C++

This is a comparison of Java and C++, two prominent object-oriented programming languages. The differences between the programming languages C++ and Java can be traced to their heritage, as they have different design goals. C++ was designed for systems and applications programming (i.e. infrastructure programming), extending the procedural programming language C, which was designed for efficient execution. To C, C++ added support for object-oriented programming, exception handling, lifetime-bas...

I’m not trying to flame or anything, but you don’t look smart if you start saying C++ and Java are the same language.
